EX LIBRIS– Who are we?
Ex Libris, Part of Clarivate, is a global EdTech (Education Technology) industry, leader. We serve some of the most prestigious academic institutions and research Universities around the world, with a total of over 7,500 customers in 90 countries.
Our SaaS solutions help universities transform academic libraries, maximize the impact of research activities, enhance teaching and learning, and drive student engagement and success. For more information about Ex Libris, see our website, and join us on Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn, and Twitter.
We are looking for a Business Operations Manager to join our team!
You will support Quote-To-Cash processes focusing mainly on supporting the sales team. You will be involved with program management for strategic initiatives and programs, identifying, resolving, and improving internal processes and procedures. You will also generate business insights and perform data analysis to support decision-making. If this sounds like an opportunity you are interested in, then we would love to talk to you!
About You – experience, education, skills, and accomplishments
Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field; OR equivalent combination of education and work experience.
3 + years of experience in Sales Operations, Business operations, Business administration, Project management, or Program management.
Knowledge of Quote-To-Cash processes.
It would be great if you also had . . .
Experience introducing sales methodologies and tools to a globally dispersed sales organization.
Ability to thoroughly analyze complex data, translating data-driven results into actionable deliverables, messages, and presentations.
Strong Analytical Skills.
Demonstrated ability to partner with varying business groups and teams to develop cross-functional tools, approaches, and processes.
Experience in Enterprise software or SaaS organization.
Salesforce Admin certification.
What will you be doing in this role?
Serve as an internal expert and primary contact in supporting the sales organization’s use of internal tools, processes, and protocols.
Ensure data accuracy and completeness in documenting and assessing regional pipelines, forecasts, and bookings.
Enhance sales productivity, enabling the sales organization to achieve increased success through simplified processes, the introduction of new tools, and streamlined access to information and resources to close sales.
Proactively identify improvement opportunities, leading the capturing and documentation of business requirements through rollout and post-implementation evaluation.
Drive alignment with the relevant functional groups (ex. MIS, Finance, and Professional Services) through the planning, implementation, and evaluation phases – collectively ideating, problem-solving, and project planning for upcoming projects and initiatives.
Monitor regional forecast and booking goals, and proactively address and resolve issues impacting the completion of bookings.
Lead and monitor managerial routines such as QBRs
About the Team
You will join a global team of Business and Sales operations experts that support the Library Software business collaborating with all org functions, such as Product, Global Sales, and Marketing through our management team.
Hours of Work / More important information for you:
Our base is in the Jerusalem, Israel office, working in a hybrid model
This is a full-time position.
Although duties are typically performed during normal business hours, occasional off-hours work may be required.
Why Ex-Libris?
At Ex Libris, we value our employees and are striving to create the perfect balance between work and home life. Join us to be part of a family-like environment; enjoy our unique culture and benefits. Be part of a thriving, productive community helping change the future of higher education with the state-of-the-art technology from Ex Libris.
At Ex Libris, we work hard and have fun doing it!
At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.Show more Report

Every day, corporations worldwide come to Barclays for our banking expertise. We help drive global commerce by providing comprehensive financial, advisory and capital-raising services. Our bankers advise on everything from mergers and acquisitions and privatisations to debt and equity financings and restructuring. Want in? Join us as an analyst.

After several weeks of intensive training to start, you’ll join one of our industry, product or geographic groups and start working on live deals and business development projects right away. financial analysis and modeling
valuation
industry research
business evaluation and strategic assessment
business and idea generation

participate in formal and informal training designed to give you the knowledge you need when you need it
receive detailed performance coaching and feedback
have opportunities to expand your network and develop leadership skills.

be motivated with a strong degree or expected degree – in any area.
